metadata.title: CVE-2018-14347 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GNU Libextractor before 1.7 contains an infinite loop vulnerability inEXTRACTOR_mpeg_extract_method (mpeg_extractor.c).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

extract - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-archive - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-av - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-exiv2 - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-flac - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-gif - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-gstreamer - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-html - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-jpeg - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-midi - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-mpeg - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-ogg - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-ole2 - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-pdf - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-rpm - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-thumbnailgtk - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-tiff - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugins-all - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugins-misc - 1:1.7-1
libextractor3 - 1:1.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libextractor package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.7-1').
